availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry S. Burnam (Garrard County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary E. Best Burnam in Madison County, Kentucky, in April 1846. Father of Sarah Burnam. Farmer in Lancaster, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Lancaster in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 694.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, p. 19.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Madison County Marriages, Film #000183314, p. 1001.
Find A Grave, "Dr Henry S. Burnam (1823-1873)," Memorial #106445478, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/106445478 (accessed October 30, 2020).
